page.title: 17Tourism
page.content: Access to the Isle of May, despite the short distance from Anstruther and Crail is difficult - weather conditions can often prevent a crossing or landing. Thus trips have to be made in settled weather conditions and must be made when the weather is right. Boats leave from the East Fife harbours of Anstruther and Crail and arrangemants must be made with either: (a) the few local boatmen licensed to take parties to the island. (b) the Observatory Committee if visitors are wishing to stay at the bird observatory. Only bird watchers can stay overnight. The Nature Conservancy Council station a warden on the island during the summer to carry out mangement work and to help the visitors who come to the island.
